Subjective: Fatigue x 2 months; all day, wakes up tired despite sleeping a lot. Work done with effort, considered calling in sick. Weekends spent resting. Exercise (climbing 2-3x/week, cycling) possible, no lack of muscle power. Muscle pain, back pain > usual. Morning stiffness. Wakes with a start sometimes (lifelong, not new, ~1x/week). Hay fever controlled with meds. Stools daily, 3-4x/day, smooth. Abdomen slightly uncomfortable on palpation. No clear cause/acute onset for fatigue. No specific joint pain. No snoring. No new respiratory issues/allergies. No palpitations/chest pain. No appetite/weight changes. No urination changes. Concern: 'Is something wrong with my body?' (muscle pain). Idea: Rheumatism. Request: Blood tests for underlying cause.
Objective: BP 110/60; HR 40-60 (athletic). Lungs clear. Back: Tenderness lumbar/sacral area, next to center. No pelvic pain. Long back muscles feel good on massage. Neck/shoulders free ROM, no pain. Abdomen: Lively peristalsis, varying percussion, supple, slightly uncomfortable on palpation, no sharp pain. No gross abnormalities.
Assessment: Fatigue, etiology unclear. Muscle pain, back pain. Morning stiffness. R/o: Anemia, thyroid dysfunction, inflammatory conditions (e.g., rheumatoid arthritis). Heart/lung issues ruled out by exam.
Plan: Explanation: No gross abnormalities found, but fatigue unusual.
Labs: Blood tests for anemia (Hb), thyroid function (TSH), inflammation markers (ESR, CRP).
Follow-up: Call day after results (expected day after test). Phone appointment to discuss.
Instructions: Form for lab in inbox; patient to make appointment at Atal Medial.
